A037001.name: Positions of the digit '2' in the decimal expansion of Pi (where positions 0, 1, 2,... refer to the digits 3, 1, 4,...).

A037002.name: Positions of the digit '3' in the decimal expansion of Pi - 3.

A037003.name: Positions of the digit '4' in the decimal expansion of Pi.

A037004.name: Positions of the digit '5' in the decimal expansion of Pi.

A037005.name: Positions of the digit '6' in the decimal expansion of Pi.

A037006.name: Positions of the digit '8' in the decimal expansion of Pi.

A037007.name: Positions of the digit '9' in the decimal expansion of Pi.

A037008.name: Positions of the digit '0' in the decimal expansion of Pi.

A037009.name: Consider an n X n board with a knight's path, not necessarily closed, that visits every square exactly once; number the squares [ 1..n^2 ] along the path; a(n) = maximal number of prime numbered squares that can be attacked by a queen.

A037011.name: Baum-Sweet cubic sequence.
formula: It appears that a(n)=sum(k=0, n-1, C(n-1+k, n-1-k)*C(n-1, k)) modulo 2 = A082759(n-1) (mod 2). It appears also that a(k)=1 iff k/3 is in A003714. - _Benoit Cloitre_, Jun 20 2003
If Cloitre's above observation holds, then we also have (assuming starting offset 0, with a(0) = 1):

A037012.name: Triangle read by rows; row 0 is 0; the n-th row for n>0 contains the coefficients in the expansion of (1-x)*(1+x)^(n-1).
formula: T(n, k) = C(n, k)-C(n, k-1) where C = binomial coefficient A007318.

T(n,k) = binomial(n-1,k) - binomial(n-1,k-1), for n >= k. T(n,k)=0, for n < k. T(n,k) = Sum_{i=-k..k} (-1)^i*binomial(n-1,k+i)*binomial(n+1,k-i), for n > 0. Row sums are 0. - _Mircea Merca_, Apr 28 2012
Sum of positive terms of the row n is the central binomial coefficient A001405(n-1).- _Ivan Neretin_, Apr 26 2016

A037013.name: Reading binary expansion from right to left, run lengths strictly decrease.

A037014.name: Numbers n with property that reading binary expansion from right to left (from least significant to most significant), run lengths do not increase.

A037015.name: Numbers n with property that, reading binary expansion of n from right to left, run lengths strictly increase.

A037016.name: Numbers n with property that reading binary expansion from right to left (least significant to most significant), run lengths do not decrease.

A037018.name: Conjecturally, largest k with no prime in [ k, k(1+1/n) ].

A037019.name: Let n = p_1*p_2*...*p_k be the prime factorization of n, with the primes sorted in descending order. Then a(n) = 2^(p_1 - 1)*3^(p_2 - 1)*...*A000040(k)^(p_k - 1).

A037020.name: Numbers n such that sum of proper (or aliquot) divisors of n is a prime.

A037021.name: Greedy sequence such that no term is the average of four others.
formula: Terms are integers of the form 122A+R, where A has 0's and 1's in its base 5 expansion, and R is in the set {0, 1, 2, 3, 5, 7, 13, 26, 27, 28, 29, 31}. - _Dennis Tseng_, Jul 19 2013

A037022.name: Triangle in which row n has the first n digits of sqrt(n) (truncated).

A037023.name: Triangle in which row n has the first n digits of sqrt(n) (rounded).

A037024.name: Position of start of first occurrence of prime(n) after the decimal point in expansion of Pi.

A037025.name: a(1) = 8; a(n+1) = least k with d(k) = a(n).

A037026.name: B-trees of order 4 with n leaves.
formula: G.f. A(x) satisfies: A(x) = x + A(x^2+x^3+x^4). [_Geoffrey Critzer_, Mar 28 2013]

A037027.name: Skew Fibonacci-Pascal triangle read by rows.
formula: T(n, m) = T'(n-1, m)+T'(n-2, m)+T'(n-1, m-1), where T'(n, m) = T(n, m) for n >= 0 and 0< = m< = n and T'(n, m) = 0 otherwise.
T(n, m) = sum(binomial(m+k, m)*binomial(k, n-k-m), k=0..n-m), n>=m>=0, else 0. - _Wolfdieter Lang_, Jun 17 2002

Chebyshev coefficient triangle (abs(A049310)) times Pascal's triangle (A007318) as product of lower triangular matrices. T(n, k)=sum{k=0..n, C((n+j)/2, j)(1+(-1)^(n+j))C(j, k)/2}. - _Paul Barry_, Dec 22 2004
Let R(n) = n-th row polynomial in x, with R(0)=1, then R(n+1)/R(n) equals the continued fraction [1+x;1+x, ...(1+x) occurring (n+1) times..., 1+x] for n>=0. - _Paul D. Hanna_, Feb 27 2004
T(n,k) = sum{j=0..n, C(n-j,j)*C(n-2*j,k)}; in Egorychev notation, T(n,k)=res_w(1-w-w^2)^(-k-1)*w^(-n+k+1). - _Paul Barry_, Sep 13 2006
T(n,k) = binomial(n,k)*hypergeom([(k-n)/2, (k-n+1)/2], [-n], -4) for n>=1. - _Peter Luschny_, Apr 25 2016

A037030.name: Numbers n such that 666*n + 1 is prime.

A037031.name: Number of combinations of n objects taken pi(n) at a time.

A037032.name: Total number of prime parts in all partitions of n.
formula: a(n) = Sum_{k=1..floor(n/2)} k*A222656(n,k). - _Alois P. Heinz_, May 29 2013
G.f.: Sum_{i>=1} x^prime(i)/(1 - x^prime(i)) / Product_{j>=1} (1 - x^j). - _Ilya Gutkovskiy_, Jan 24 2017

A037033.name: Earliest sequence of 6 primes according to the rules stipulated in A005150.

A037034.name: Least k such that 4*n*k-1 is a prime.

A037035.name: Least k such that 2^n+1+k is a prime.

A037036.name: Least k such that 2^n+1-k is a prime.

A037037.name: Number of primes between n and 3n.
formula: a(n) = A000720(3n) - A000720(n-1). - _Wesley Ivan Hurt_, Jun 15 2013

A037038.name: Number of primes between n and 4n+1.

A037039.name: Least k such that 4*n*k+1 is a prime.

A037041.name: Number of quadratic residues mod n for some n (A000224 sorted and duplicates removed).

A037042.name: 2-White numbers (take power 2, sum 2-digit groups to get same number).

A037043.name: 3-white numbers: partition digits of n^3 into blocks of 3 starting at right; then sum of these 3-digit numbers equals n.

A037044.name: 4-white numbers: partition digits of n^4 into blocks of 4 starting at right; sum of these 4-digit numbers equals n.

A037045.name: 5-white numbers: partition digits of n^5 into blocks of 5 starting at right; sum of these 5-digit numbers equals n.

A037046.name: Numbers that are not the number of quadratic residues mod n for any n.

A037047.name: Starting at n, "say what you see"; sequence gives number of primes obtained before first composite number appears.

A037048.name: Number of pairs {i,j}, i>1, j>1, such that ij < n^2.

A037049.name: Smallest number with two distinct prime factors both of length n.

A037050.name: Numbers n such that product of n with sum of next n consecutive integers is palindromic.

A037051.name: Palindromic product of some n with sum of next n consecutive integers.

A037052.name: a(n)-th prime is the smallest prime containing exactly n 0's.

A037054.name: a(n)-th prime is the smallest prime containing exactly n 1's.

A037055.name: Smallest prime containing exactly n 1's.
formula: a(n) = the smallest prime in { R-10^n, R-10^(n-1), ..., R-10; R+a*10^b, a=1, ..., 8, b=0, 1, 2, ..., n }, where R = (10^(n+1)-1)/9 is the (n+1)-digit repunit. - _M. F. Hasler_, Feb 25 2016

A037056.name: a(n)-th prime is the smallest prime containing exactly n 2's.

A037058.name: a(n)-th prime is the smallest prime containing exactly n 3's.

A037060.name: a(n)-th prime is the smallest prime containing exactly n 4's.

A037062.name: a(n)-th prime is the smallest prime containing exactly n 5's.

A037064.name: a(n)-th prime is the smallest prime containing exactly n 6's.

A037066.name: a(n)-th prime is the smallest prime containing exactly n 7's.

A037068.name: a(n)-th prime is the smallest prime containing exactly n 8's.

A037070.name: a(n)-th prime is the smallest prime containing exactly n 9's.

A037072.name: Squares which are the sum of twin prime pairs.

A037073.name: Numbers k such that (6*k)^2 is the sum of a twin prime pair.
formula: isa := n -> isprime(n) and isprime(n+2) and issqr(2*n+2):

A037074.name: Numbers that are the product of a pair of twin primes.

A037075.name: Number of eutactic lattices in dimension n.

A037076.name: Palindromes which are the sum of a twin prime pair.

A037077.name: Decimal expansion of upper limit of - 1^(1/1) + 2^(1/2) - 3^(1/3) + ... .

A037078.name: In ternary expansion of n, reading from right to left, digits occur in order ...,0,1,2,0,1,2,...

A037079.name: In ternary expansion of n, reading from left to right, digits occur in order ...,0,1,2,0,1,2,...

A037080.name: In ternary expansion of n, reading from right to left, successive runs of the digits occur in order ...,0,1,2,0,1,2,...

A037081.name: In ternary expansion of n, reading from left to right, successive runs of the digits occur in order ...,0,1,2,0,1,2,...

A037083.name: Numbers n such that n!!! + 1 is prime (0 is included by convention).

A037084.name: Positive integers not going to 1 under iterations of the map in A001281: n->3n-1 if n odd, n->n/2 if n even.

A037088.name: Triangle read by rows: T(n,k) is number of numbers x, 2^n <= x < 2^(n+1), with k prime factors (counted with multiplicity).

A037089.name: Lexicographically earliest strictly increasing decimal autovarious sequence: a(n) = number of distinct n-digit endings (left-zero-padded) of elements in the sequence.

A037090.name: Lexicographically earliest strictly increasing base-2 autovarious sequence: a(n) = number of distinct a(k) mod 2^n (written in base 2).

A037091.name: Lexicographically earliest strictly increasing base 3 autovarious sequence: a(n) = number of distinct a(k) mod 3^n (written in base 3).

A037092.name: Number of triples {i,j,k}, i>1, j>1, k>1, such that ijk < n^3.

A037093.name: "Sloping binary representation" of Fibonacci numbers, slope = +1.
formula: In practice, n can be used as an upper limit instead of infinity.

A037094.name: "Sloping binary representation" of Lucas numbers (A000032), slope = +1.
formula: In practice, 3n (2n?) can be used as an upper limit instead of infinity.

A037095.name: "Sloping binary representation" of powers of 3 (A000244), slope = -1.

A037096.name: Periodic vertical binary vectors computed for powers of 3: a(n) = Sum_{k=0 .. (2^n)-1} (floor((3^k)/(2^n)) mod 2) * 2^k.

A037097.name: Periodic vertical binary vectors of powers of 3, starting from bit-column 2 (halved).
formula: a(n) = Sum_{k=0..A000225(n-1)} ([A000244(k)/(2^n)] mod 2) * 2^k, where [] stands for floor function.

A037100.name: Lexically first set of (even) numbers, beginning with 4, such that for any two different terms, a(i) + a(j) + 1 is prime.

A037101.name: Trajectory of 3 under map n->7n+1 if n odd, n->n/2 if n even.

A037102.name: Trajectory of 3 under map n->9n+1 if n odd, n->n/2 if n even.

A037103.name: Trajectory of 3 under map n->11n+1 if n odd, n->n/2 if n even

A037104.name: Trajectory of 3 under map n->13n+1 if n odd, n->n/2 if n even

A037105.name: Trajectory of 3 under map n->15n+1 if n odd, n->n/2 if n even

A037106.name: Trajectory of 3 under map n->17n+1 if n odd, n->n/2 if n even

A037107.name: Trajectory of 3 under map n->19n+1 if n odd, n->n/2 if n even

A037108.name: Trajectory of 3 under map n->21n+1 if n odd, n->n/2 if n even

A037109.name: Trajectory of 3 under map n->23n+1 if n odd, n->n/2 if n even

A037110.name: Trajectory of 3 under map n->25n+1 if n odd, n->n/2 if n even

A037111.name: Trajectory of 3 under map n->27n+1 if n odd, n->n/2 if n even

A037112.name: Trajectory of 3 under map n->29n+1 if n odd, n->n/2 if n even

A037113.name: Trajectory of 3 under map n->31n+1 if n odd, n->n/2 if n even

A037114.name: Trajectory of 3 under map n->33n+1 if n odd, n->n/2 if n even

A037115.name: Trajectory of 3 under map n->35n+1 if n odd, n->n/2 if n even

A037116.name: Trajectory of 3 under map n->37n+1 if n odd, n->n/2 if n even

A037117.name: Trajectory of 3 under map n->39n+1 if n odd, n->n/2 if n even

A037118.name: Trajectory of 3 under map n->41n+1 if n odd, n->n/2 if n even

A037119.name: Trajectory of 3 under map n->43n+1 if n odd, n->n/2 if n even

A037120.name: Trajectory of 3 under map n->45n+1 if n odd, n->n/2 if n even

A037121.name: Trajectory of 3 under map n -> 47n+1 if n odd, n->n/2 if n even.

A037122.name: Trajectory of 3 under map n->49n+1 if n odd, n->n/2 if n even

A037123.name: a(n) = a(n-1) + sum of digits of n.
formula: a(n) = Sum_{k=0..n} s(k) = Sum_{k=0..n} A007953(k), where s(k) denote the sum of the digits of k in decimal representation. Asymptotic expression: a(n-1) = Sum_{k=0..n-1} s(k) = 4.5*n*log_10(n) + O(n). - Antonio G. Astudillo (afg_astudillo(AT)hotmail.com), Sep 07 2002
a(n) = n*(n+1)/2 - 9*Sum_{k=1..n} Sum_{i=1..ceiling(log_10(k))} floor(k/10^i). - _Benoit Cloitre_, Aug 28 2003
a(n) = a(n mod m) + MSD*a(m - 1) + (MSD*(MSD - 1)/2)*m + MSD*((n mod m) + 1), where m = 10^(A055642(n) - 1), MSD = A000030(n). (End)

A037124.name: Numbers that contain only one nonzero digit.
formula: A138707(a(n)) = A000005(a(n)); A061116 is a subsequence. - _Reinhard Zumkeller_, Mar 26 2008
a(n+1) = a(n) + a(n - n mod 9). - _Reinhard Zumkeller_, May 26 2008
a(n) = (10^floor((n - 1)/9))*(n - 9*floor((n - 1)/9)). - _José de Jesús Camacho Medina_, Nov 10 2014

a(n) ≍ 1.2589...^n, where the constant is A011279. (f ≍ g when f << g and g << f, that is, there are absolute constants c,C > 0 such that for all large n, |f(n)| <= c|g(n)| and |g(n)| <= C|f(n)|.) - _Charles R Greathouse IV_, Mar 11 2021

A037125.name: Irregular triangle: row n is 1, 2, 3, 4, .., prime(n).

A037126.name: Triangle T(n,k) = prime(k) for k = 1..n.
formula: As a linear array, the sequence is a(n) = A000040(m), where m = n-t(t+1)/2, t=floor((-1+sqrt(8*n-7))/2). - _Boris Putievskiy_, Dec 12 2012

A037134.name: Number of ways of writing n as a+b where a is abundant (or perfect), b is deficient (or perfect) and s(a)-a=b-s(b) (s(x)=sigma(x)-x).

A037135.name: Number of ways of writing n=a+b where |s(a)-a|=|s(b)-b|, s(x)=sigma(x)-x.

A037136.name: Numbers n such that A037134(n) = A037135(n).

A037137.name: Numbers n such that A037134(n) = A037135(n) > 0.

A037138.name: Numbers k such that sigma(totient(k)) + sigma(cototient(k)) = 2k.

A037139.name: Deficient numbers n such that n-s(n)-s(n-s(n)) = s(s(n))-s(n) or s(n-s(n))-n+s(n) = s(n)-s(s(n)).

A037140.name: Convolution of natural numbers n >= 1 with Fibonacci numbers F(k), for k >= 5.

A037141.name: Convolution of natural numbers n >= 1 with Fibonacci numbers F(k), for k >= -5, with F(-n)=(-1)^(n+1)*F(n);.

A037142.name: Erroneous version of A047995: Number of impartial misere games born on or before day n.

A037143.name: Numbers with at most 2 prime factors (counted with multiplicity).

A037144.name: Numbers with at most 3 prime factors (counted with multiplicity).
formula: a(n) ~ 2n log n/(log log n)^2. - _Charles R Greathouse IV_, Sep 14 2015

A037146.name: Numerators of Fourier coefficients of Eisenstein series of degree 2 and weight 10 when evaluated at Gram(A_2)*z.
formula: G.f.: x^20 - 120*x^14*y + 1728*x^8*y^2 + (1330587648/43867)*x^2*y^3 where x = phi_0(z) and y = Delta_12(z). See A037150 for definitions of these quantities. - _N. J. A. Sloane_, Dec 12 2020

A037147.name: Denominators of Fourier coefficients of Eisenstein series of degree 2 and weight 10 when evaluated at Gram(A_2)*z.
formula: x^20 - 120*x^14*y + 1728*x^8*y^2 + (1330587648/43867)*x^2*y^3, x = phi_0(z), y = Delta_12(z). (See A037150 for explanation and Maple code. -  _N. J. A. Sloane_, Dec 12 2020)

A037148.name: Numerators of Fourier coefficients of Eisenstein series of degree 2 and weight 12 when evaluated at Gram(A_2)*z.

A037149.name: Denominators of Fourier coefficients of Eisenstein series of degree 2 and weight 12 when evaluated at Gram(A_2)*z.

A037150.name: Fourier coefficients of Eisenstein series of degree 2 and weight 6 when evaluated at Gram(A_2)*z.
formula: x^12-72*x^6*y-1728*y^2, x = phi_0(z), y = Delta_12(z). Here phi_0(z) is the theta series of the A_2 lattice - see A004016, and Delta_12 is the 12-dimensional cusp form given in A007332.

A037153.name: a(n) = p-n!, where p is the smallest prime > n!+1.

A037155.name: a(n) = n!-p, where p is the largest prime < (n!-1).

A037157.name: Convolution of natural numbers n >= 1 with Fibonacci numbers F(k), for k >= 6.

A037158.name: Convolution of natural numbers n >= 1 with Fibonacci numbers F(k), for k >= -7, with F(-n)=(-1)^(n+1)*F(n).

A037159.name: Consider the trajectory of n under the iteration of a map which sends x to 3x - sigma(x) if this is >= 0; otherwise the iteration stops. The sequence gives values of n which eventually reach 0.

A037161.name: Well-order the rational numbers; take numerators.

A037162.name: Well-order the rational numbers; take denominators.

A037164.name: Numerators of coefficients of Eisenstein series E_12(q) (or E_6(q) or E_24(q)).

A037168.name: a(n) = 2*prime(n) - 2.
formula: a(n) = 2 * prime(n) - 2 =  2 * phi(prime(n)). - _Alonso del Arte_, Jun 30 2013

A037169.name: Prime(n)* Product(prime(n-k) mod prime(n-k-1)); k=0,1...n-2.
formula: Let M_n be the n X n matrix m(i, j)=Max(prime(i), prime(j)); then a(n)=(-1)^(n+1)*det(M_n). - _Benoit Cloitre_, May 11 2002

A037170.name: Numbers n such that n = pi(n) + phi(n), where pi = A000720, phi = A000010.

A037171.name: Numbers n such that phi(n) = pi(n), i.e., A000010(n) = A000720(n).

A037172.name: Numbers n such that sigma(n) - n = {number of primes <= n}.

A037173.name: Numbers that are not the sum of consecutive composite numbers.

A037174.name: Primes which are not the sum of consecutive composite numbers.

A037175.name: Numbers n such that |s(n)-n| = number of primes <= n, where s(n) is sigma(n)-n.

A037176.name: Numbers n such that us(n) = number of primes <= n, where usigma(n) = sum of unitary divisors of n (A034448), us(n) is usigma(n)-n.

A037177.name: Numbers n such that 2047*2^n+1 is prime.

A037178.name: Longest cycle when squaring modulo n-th prime.
formula: Let p=prime(n) and k=A000265(p-1), the odd part of p-1. Then a(n) = ord(2,k), that is, the smallest positive integer x such that 2^x = 1 (mod k). - _T. D. Noe_, Jun 24 2008

A037179.name: Number of cycles when squaring modulo n-th prime.
formula: a(n) = 1+ Sum_{d|rho} phi(d)/ord(2,d) with rho the largest odd factor of prime(n)-1 (rho = A000265(p-1). The 1 corresponds to the sink 0. - _Michel Marcus_, Jan 30 2016

A037180.name: Number of different cycle lengths when squaring modulo n-th prime.

A037182.name: a(n) = 10^n*(10^n-1) / 2.
formula: Sum_{i=1..10^n-1} i = the (10^n-1)th triangular number (A000217). - _Marvin Ray Burns_

A037183.name: Smallest number that is palindromic (with at least 2 digits) in n bases.

A037184.name: Functional digraphs with 1 node not in the image.

A037185.name: Number of ways of placing 2n points on n X n grid so no 3 are in a line (solutions with no symmetry).

A037186.name: Number of ways of placing 2n points on n X n grid so no 3 are in a line (solutions with symmetry about one main diagonal).

A037187.name: Number of ways of placing 2n points on n X n grid so no 3 are in a line (solutions with 180 deg rotational symmetry).

A037188.name: Number of ways of placing 2n points on n X n grid so no 3 are in a line (solutions with symmetry about both main diagonals).

A037189.name: Number of ways of placing 4n points on 2n X 2n grid so no 3 are in a line (solutions with either 90-degree rotational symmetry or full symmetry).

A037190.name: Theta series of lattice A_2 tensor D12+ (dimension 24, min norm 4).
formula: G.f.: phi_0(z)^12 - 72*phi_0(z)^6*Delta_12(z) + 576*Delta_12(z)^2 where phi_0(z) is the theta series of the A_2 lattice given in A004016, and Delta_12 is the 12-dimensional cusp form given in A007332. - _Sean A. Irvine_, Dec 16 2020

A037191.name: Theta series of lattice A_2 tensor E_7^2+ (dimension 28, min norm 4).
formula: G.f.: phi_0(z)^14 - 84*phi_0(z)^8*Delta_12(z) + 1008*phi_0(z)^2*Delta_12(z)^2 where phi_0(z) is the theta series of the A_2 lattice given in A004016, and Delta_12 is the 12-dimensional cusp form given in A007332. - _Sean A. Irvine_, Dec 16 2020

A037193.name: Number of consonants in n (in French).

A037194.name: Number of vowels in n (in French).

A037195.name: Number of consonants in the American English name of n.

A037196.name: Number of vowels in the American English name of n.

A037197.name: Number of divisors of sigma(n) = number of divisors of n.
formula: Conjecture: for n > 10^6, a(n) < n^2. - _Benoit Cloitre_, Aug 24 2002

A037198.name: Number of divisors of (sigma(n)-n) = number of divisors of n.

A037199.name: Number of consonants in n (in German).

A037200.name: Number of vowels in n (in German).

A037201.name: Differences between consecutive primes (A001223) but with repeats omitted.

A037202.name: Number of lines in Pratt certificate for n-th prime.
formula: a(2)=1, a(n)= 1 + Sum a(p), p prime, p | n-1, where n runs through primes.

A037203.name: Number of terms by which A001223 lags behind A037201.

A037204.name: Numbers that occur in runs of length 1 in A037203.

A037205.name: a(n) = (n+1)^n - 1.
formula: a(n) = Sum_{k=1..n} binomial(n,k)*n^k [from _Paolo Xausa_'s comment]. - _Joerg Arndt_, Apr 12 2021

A037207.name: Smallest natural number k such that periodic part of 1/k is n, or 0 if no such k exists.

A037208.name: Numbers n such that q^2 < p, where p=nextprime(n), q=nextprime(square root of n).

A037209.name: Primes n such that nextprime(n) - n = ( number of divisors of (nextprime(n)+n)/2 )-1.

A037210.name: Numbers n such that p-n=p#-n#, where p=nextprime(n), n#=nextprime(square root of n), p#=nextprime(square root of p).

A037211.name: Smallest natural number k such that periodic part of 1/sqrt(k) is n (or 0 if no such number).

A037212.name: Theta series of lattice A_2 tensor A_15+ (dimension 30, det 3^15, min. norm 4).
formula: G.f.: phi_0(z)^15 - 90*phi_0(z)^9*Delta_12(z) + 1260*phi_0(z)^3*Delta_12(z)^2 where phi_0(z) is the theta series of the A_2 lattice given in A004016, and Delta_12 is the 12-dimensional cusp form given in A007332. - _Sean A. Irvine_, Dec 17 2020

A037213.name: Expansion of Sum_{n>=0} n*q^(n^2).
formula: Dirichlet generating function: zeta(2*s-1). - _Franklin T. Adams-Watters_, Sep 11 2005.
a(n) = sqrt(n) * floor( cos^2(Pi * sqrt(n)) ). - _Carl R. White_, May 23 2009

A037214.name: Expansion of (sum(n*q^(n^2), n=0..inf))^2.
formula: a(n) = sum x*y for integers x,y such that x^2+y^2=n and x>0,y>=0. - _Cristóbal Camarero_, Oct 03 2014

If a(n)>0, then a(n)>=2*sqrt(n-1) except for a(2)=1 and a(8)=4. Proof: The extremal values a nonzero term x*y in the above sum can have is x=1, y=sqrt(n-1) in which case it occurs a second time with x,y swapped (except for x=y=1), and x=y=sqrt(n/2) in which case it may occur only once, but x*y=n/2 is larger than 2*sqrt(n-1) for n>=15. - _M. F. Hasler_, Oct 14 2014

A037218.name: Smallest natural number k such that periodic part of 1/k is the prime p(n), or 0 if no such k exists.

A037219.name: Theta series for 10-dimensional 4-modular lattice Q10 with minimal norm 4.

A037221.name: Number of near-rings (or nearrings) definable on cyclic group of order n.

A037223.name: Number of solutions to non-attacking rooks problem on n X n board that are invariant under 180-degree rotation.
formula: E.g.f.: 1 + x + (1 + x + x^2)*exp(x^2/2)*sqrt(Pi/2)*erf(x/sqrt(2)), where erf denotes the error function. - Antonio G. Astudillo (afg_astudillo(AT)hotmail.com), Nov 01 2002
For asymptotics see the Robinson paper.
E.g.f.: Q(0)  where Q(k)= 1 + x/(2*k + 1 - x*(2*k+1)/(x+1/Q(k+1))); (continued fraction, 3-step). - _Sergei N. Gladkovskii_, Sep 21 2012
E.g.f.: 1/(W(0)-x)  where W(k)= x + 1/(1 + x/(2*k + 1 - x*(2*k+1)/W(k+1))); (continued fraction, 3-step). - _Sergei N. Gladkovskii_, Sep 22 2012
D-finite with recurrence: a(n) +a(n-1) -n*a(n-2) +(-n+2)*a(n-3)=0. - _R. J. Mathar_, Feb 20 2020

A037224.name: Number of permutations p of {1,2,3...,n} that are fixed points under the operation of first reversing p, then taking the inverse.

A037226.name: a(n) = phi(2n+1) / multiplicative order of 2 mod 2n+1.
formula: a(n) = Sum{d|2n+1} mu((2n+1)/d) A000374(d), the inverse Mobius transform of A000374 - _T. D. Noe_, Aug 01 2003

A037227.name: If n = 2^m*k, k odd, then a(n) = 2*m+1.
formula: a(n) = Sum_{d divides n} (-1)^(d+1)*mu(d)*tau(n/d). Multiplicative with a(p^e) = 2*e+1 if p = 2; 1 if p > 2. - _Vladeta Jovovic_, Apr 27 2003
a((2*n-1)*2^p)  = 2*p+1, p  >= 0 and n >= 1. - _Johannes W. Meijer_, Feb 07 2013
a(n*2^(k+1) + 2^k) = 2*k + 1 for n,k >= 0; thus a(2*n+1) = 1, a(4*n+2) = 3, a(8*n+4) = 5, a(16*n+8) = 7 and so on. Note the square array ( n*2^(k+1) + 2^k - 1 )n, k>=0 is the transpose of A075300.

A037230.name: Numbers n such that phi(n) < pi(n).

A037231.name: Primes which set a new record for length of Pratt certificate.

A037232.name: Number of matchings in graph C_{3} X C_{3} X P_{n}.

A037233.name: Order of (4,n) cage, i.e., minimal order of 4-regular graph of girth n.

A037234.name: a(n) = number of rings with n elements.
formula: a(m n) = a(m) a(n) when gcd(m,n) = 1. (Multiplicativity.)
a(p^3) = 3p + 50 for any odd prime p [Antipkin & Elizarov]. (End)

A037238.name: x -> 5x - 1 if x odd, else x -> x/2.

A037239.name: Numerator of Pi^(2n)/(GAMMA(2n)*(1-2^(-2n))*Zeta(2n)); = 8*(highest power of 2 dividing n).

A037245.name: Number of unrooted self-avoiding walks of n steps on square lattice.

A037246.name: Total number of fixed points in free homeomorphically irreducible trees with n nodes.

A037247.name: Reversion of g.f. (beginning with x term) for number of trees with n nodes.

A037254.name: Triangle read by rows: T(n,k) (n >= 1, 1 <= k< = n) gives number of non-distorting tie-avoiding integer vote weights.

A037255.name: For n weights, number of combinations when limited to two weights per pan.
formula: G.f.: -x*(x^3+2*x^2-x+1) / (x-1)^5. - _Colin Barker_, Apr 16 2013 [corrected by _Georg Fischer_, May 11 2019]

A037257.name: a() = 1,3,... [ A037257 ], differences = 2,... [ A037258 ] and 2nd differences [ A037259 ] are disjoint and monotonic; adjoin next free number to 2nd differences unless it would produce a duplicate in which case ignore.

A037260.name: a()=A037260 and its first [ A037261 ], 2nd [ A037262 ] and 3rd [ A037263 ] differences together include every number at most once and are monotonic and minimal.

A037264.name: Numbers n such that sum of reciprocals of digits is reciprocal of an integer.

A037266.name: Numbers n such that no extremal Groemer packing of n circles exists.

A037267.name: Number of Boolean functions on n inputs with representing polynomial of max degree n.

A037270.name: a(n) = n^2*(n^2 + 1)/2.
formula: a(n) = A000537(n)+A000537(n-1), i.e., square of sum of first n integers plus square of sum of first n-1 integers. - _Henry Bottomley_, Oct 15 2001
a(n) = Sum_{k=0..n^2} k. - _William A. Tedeschi_, Feb 27 2008
a(n) = a(n-1) + A005898(n-1). - _Ivan N. Ianakiev_, May 13 2012
For n>0, a(n) = A000217(n)^2 + A000217(n-1)^2. - _Richard R. Forberg_, Dec 25 2013
a(n) = T(T(n)) + T(T(n-1)) + T(T(n)-1) + T(T(n-1)-1), where T(n) = A000217(n). - _Charlie Marion_, Sep 10 2016
G.f.: (Sum_{j=1..4} S2(4,j)*j!*x^j/(1-x)^(j+1) + Sum_{j=1..2} S2(2,j)*j!*x^j/(1-x)^(j+1)) / 2, where S2 is the Stirling subset number A008277.
E.g.f.: (Sum_{k=1..4} S2(4,k)*x^k + Sum_{k=1..2} S2(2,k)*x^k) * exp(x) / 2, where S2 is the Stirling subset number A008277.
For n > 0, a(n) = Sum_{k=1..n} A317617(n,k). - _Stefano Spezia_, Jan 10 2019

A037271.name: Number of steps to reach a prime under "replace n with concatenation of its prime factors" when applied to n-th composite number, or -1 if no such number.

A037272.name: Primes reached in A037271, or -1 if no such prime exists.

A037273.name: Number of steps to reach a prime under "replace n with concatenation of its prime factors", or -1 if no prime is ever reached.

A037274.name: Home primes: for n >= 2, a(n) = the prime that is finally reached when you start with n, concatenate its prime factors (A037276) and repeat until a prime is reached (a(n) = -1 if no prime is ever reached).

A037275.name: Subsequence of record holders in A037274.

A037276.name: Start with 1; for n>1, replace n with the concatenation of its prime factors in increasing order.

A037277.name: Replace n with concatenation of its divisors >1.

A037278.name: Replace n with concatenation of its divisors.

A037279.name: If n is composite, replace n with the concatenation of its proper divisors, otherwise a(n) = n.

A037280.name: If n is composite replace n with the concatenation of its nontrivial divisors [ A037279 ] then divide out any factors of 2.

A037281.name: Number of iterations of transformation in A037280 needed to reach 1 or a prime, or -1 if no such number exists.

A037282.name: Scan n from left to right once, erasing any primes.

A037283.name: Replace n with concatenation of its odd divisors.

A037284.name: Replace n with concatenation of its odd divisors >1.

A037285.name: Replace n with concatenation of its nontrivial odd divisors.

A037286.name: Replace 2n+1 with concatenation of its divisors.

A037287.name: Replace 2n+1 with concatenation of its divisors >1.

A037288.name: Replace 2n+1 with concatenation of its nontrivial divisors.

A037289.name: Number of commutative rings with n elements.
formula: a(p^n) = p^(2/27 * n^3 + O(n^(8/3))), see Theorems 11.2 and 11.3 in Poonen 2008. - _Charles R Greathouse IV_, Jul 10 2012

A037302.name: Normalized volume of Birkhoff polytope of n X n doubly-stochastic square matrices. If the volume is v(n), then a(n) = ((n-1)^2)! * v(n) / n^(n-1).

A037306.name: Triangle T(n,k) read by rows: the number of compositions of n into k parts, modulo cyclic shifts.

A037444.name: Number of partitions of n^2 into squares.
formula: a(n) = A001156(n^2) = coefficient of x^(n^2) in the series expansion of Prod_{k>=1} 1/(1 - x^(k^2)).

A037445.name: Number of infinitary divisors (or i-divisors) of n.
formula: Multiplicative with a(p^e) = 2^A000120(e). - _David W. Wilson_, Sep 01 2001
Let n = q_1*...*q_k, where q_1,...,q_k are different terms of A050376. Then a(n) = 2^k (the number of subsets of a set with k elements is 2^k). - _Vladimir Shevelev_, Feb 19 2011.
a(n) = A286575(A156552(n)). [Because multiplicative with a(p^e) = A001316(e).]

A037447.name: Number of conjugacy classes of subgroups of the Chevalley group A_n(2) (the group of nonsingular n X n matrices over GF(2)).

A037450.name: Numbers which are one less than a perfect square that cannot otherwise be written as a power.

A037451.name: a(n) = Fibonacci(n) * Fibonacci(2*n).
formula: a(n) = (1/5)*(Lucas(3*n) - (-1)^n*Lucas(n)) = (1/5)*(Lucas(3*n) - Lucas(-n)). In general, for r = s (mod 2) the sequence Lucas(r*n) - Lucas(s*n) is a divisibility sequence. Cf. A273622. - _Peter Bala_, May 27 2016
Lim_{n->infinity} a(n+1)/a(n) = 2 + sqrt(5) = A098317. - _Ilya Gutkovskiy_, Jun 01 2016

A037452.name: Let F(x) = 1 + 1*x + 4*x^2 + 10*x^3 + ..., the g.f. for A000293 (solid partitions), and write F(x) = 1/Product_{n>=1} (1 - x^n)^a(n).

A037453.name: Positive numbers n such that the base 5 representation of n contains no 3 or 4.
formula: a(3n)=5a(n), a(3n+1)=5a(n)+1, a(3n+2)=5a(n)+2, where by definition a(0)=0. - _Emeric Deutsch_, Mar 23 2004

A037454.name: a(n) = Sum_{i=0..m} d(i)*6^i, where Sum_{i=0..m} d(i)*3^i is the base 3 representation of n.
formula: a(0) = 0; a(n) = 6*a(n/3) if n == 0 (mod 3) else a(n) = a(n-1) + 1. (End)

A037455.name: a(n)=Sum{d(i)*7^i: i=0,1,...,m}, where Sum{d(i)*3^i: i=0,1,...,m} is the base 3 representation of n.

A037456.name: a(n)=Sum{d(i)*8^i: i=0,1,...,m}, where Sum{d(i)*3^i: i=0,1,...,m} is the base 3 representation of n.

A037458.name: a(1)=1; for n > 1, a(n) = n - a(n-floor(sqrt(n))).

A037800.name: Number of occurrences of 01 in the binary expansion of n.
formula: a(2n) = a(n), a(2n+1) = a(n) + [n is even]. - _Ralf Stephan_, Aug 21 2003
G.f.: 1/(1-x) * Sum_{k>=0} t^5/(1+t)/(1+t^2) where t=x^2^k. - _Ralf Stephan_, Sep 10 2003
Sum_{n>=1} a(n)/(n*(n+1)) = log(2)/2 + Pi/4 - 1 = A231902 - 1 (Allouche and Shallit, 1990). - _Amiram Eldar_, Jun 01 2021

A037806.name: Number of i such that d(i)<d(i-1), where Sum{d(i)*8^i: i=0,1,...,m} is the base 8 representation of n.
formula: For 0 <= j <= 7, a(8*i+j) = a(i) + 1 if (i mod 8) < j, a(i) otherwise. - _Robert Israel_, May 17 2019

A037809.name: Number of i such that d(i) <= d(i-1), where Sum_{i=0..m} d(i)*2^i is the base-2 representation of n.
formula: a(n) = b(n) - 1, with b(0)=0, b(2n) = b(n) + [n even], b(2n+1) = b(n) + 1. (End)

A037842.name: Fibonacci numbers in base 1.
formula: a(n+2) = concat( a(n+1), a(n) ), a(0) = 1, a(1) = 11. - corrected by _Jason Kimberley_, Dec 17 2012

A037843.name: Number of matrices with n columns whose rows do not cover each other; ordered antichains of subsets of an n-set.
formula: a(n)=Sum_{k=0..C(n, floor(n/2))}k!*M(n, k) where M(n, k) is the number of distinct monotone Boolean functions of n variables with k mincuts.

A037861.name: (Number of 0's) - (number of 1's) in the base-2 representation of n.
formula: G.f. satisfies A(x) = (1 + x)*A(x^2) - x*(2 + x)/(1 + x). - _Franklin T. Adams-Watters_, Dec 26 2006
a(n) = b(n) for n > 0 with b(0) = 0 and b(n) = b(floor(n/2)) + (-1)^(n mod 2). - _Reinhard Zumkeller_, Dec 31 2007

A037952.name: a(n) = binomial(n, floor((n-1)/2)).
formula: D-finite with recurrence: (n+2)*a(n) + (-n-2)*a(n-1) + 2*(-2*n+1)*a(n-2) + 4*(n-2)*a(n-3) = 0. - _R. J. Mathar_, Jan 25 2013. Proved by _Robert Israel_, Nov 13 2014
a(n) = binomial(n, (n-2)/2), n even; a(n) = binomial(n, (n+1)/2), n odd. - _Enrique Navarrete_, Dec 21 2019

A037953.name: C(n,[ (n-5)/2 ]).
formula: a(n) = binomial(n, A004526(n-5)). - _Wesley Ivan Hurt_, Nov 28 2013

A037955.name: a(n) = binomial(n, floor(n/2)-1).
formula: G.f.: g(z) = z^2*c^3/(1-z*c), where c = (1-sqrt(1-4*z^2))/(2*z^2) is the Catalan function with argument z^2. - _Emeric Deutsch_, Jun 06 2011
a(n) = binomial(n, (n-2)/2), n even; a(n) = binomial(n, (n-3)/2), n odd. - _Enrique Navarrete_, Dec 20 2019

A037956.name: C(n,[ (n-4)/2 ]).
formula: Mathar's recurrence verified using the D.E.(4*x^4-x^2)*y'' + (16*x^3+2*x^2-2*x)*y' + (8*x^2+2*x+20)*y = 0 satisfied by the G.f. (End)

A037958.name: a(n) = binomial(n, floor((n-8)/2)).
formula: Conjecture: -(n+9)*(n-8)*a(n) +2*(n)*a(n-1) +4*n*(n-1)*a(n-2)=0. - _R. J. Mathar_, Jul 26 2015, verified by _Robert Israel_, Jun 28 2018
E.g.f.: I_8(2*x)+I_9(2*x), where I_k is the modified Bessel function of the first kind and order k.

A037965.name: a(n) = n*binomial(2*n-2, n-1).
formula: Starting (1, 4, 18, 80, ...), = binomial transform of A134757: (1, 3, 11, 37, 123, 401, ...); and double binomial transform of A100071 starting (1, 2, 6, 12, 30, ...). - _Gary W. Adamson_, Nov 08 2007

A037966.name: a(n) = n^2*binomial(2*n-2, n-1).
formula: a(n) = n^2*A000984(n-1). - _Zerinvary Lajos_, Jan 18 2007, corrected Jul 26 2015
a(n) = n*A037965(n). - _Zerinvary Lajos_, Jan 18 2007, corrected Jul 26 2015
